762.question: How large are the improvements of the Attention-Sum Reader model when using the BookTest dataset?
762.response: {'Answer': 'The improvements of the Attention-Sum Reader model when using the BookTest dataset are notable in both Named Entity and Common Noun categories. Specifically, the AS Reader (single model) achieves a test accuracy of 76.2% for named entities, which is a significant improvement over its performance on the CBT NE dataset with 68.6% accuracy, and for common nouns, the AS Reader (single model) attains a test accuracy of 83.2% as opposed to 63.4% on the CBT CN dataset. Similarly, the AS Reader (greedy ensemble) shows improvement, reaching
762.answer: Answer with content missing: (Table 2) Accuracy of best AS reader results including ensembles are 78.4 and 83.7 when trained on BookTest compared to 71.0 and 68.9 when trained on CBT for Named endity and Common noun respectively.
